items.title: The Feds Are Offering Migrants Cash to Self-Deport. Lawyers Call These Incentives Misleading.
items.description: The government’s offer to pay a stipend, waive fees, and let people return legally to the U.S. go against current law and court practices, immigration...

items.title: From Budget Chaos to Public Defenders: Mississippi Poised to Fund ‘Day 1’ Experiment
items.description: Indigent felony defendants in many counties have lacked court-appointed lawyers before indictment, even while they sat in jails for weeks or months.

items.title: Cuyahoga Deputy Who Shot at Two Teens Was Deemed Unfit for Suburban Force
items.description: Deputy Isen Vajusi struggled with confidence, stress and field training before being forced out of the suburbs. He’s now on the sheriff’s downtown saf...

items.title: What History Tells Us to Expect From Trump’s Escalation in Los Angeles Protests
items.description: Since the 1960s, studies have shown that heavy-handed policing and militarized responses tend to make protests more volatile — not less.

items.title: From New York to Arizona, More States Consider Curbing Drug Testing at Childbirth
items.description: Some bills followed an investigation by The Marshall Project and Reveal that exposed the harms of widespread drug testing of pregnant patients.
